info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 01 at 3:20PM CDT until July 01 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Madison County in southwestern Illinois... Northern St. Louis City in east central Missouri... Central St. Charles County in east central Missouri... Northeastern St. Louis County in east central Missouri... * Until 400 PM CDT. * At 320 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Maryland Heights, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... University City, Maryland Heights, Hazelwood, Creve Coeur, Overland, St. Ann, Bridgeton, Berkeley, Ladue, and Olivette around 325 PM CDT. Florissant, Ferguson, Jennings, Dellwood, Normandy, Northwoods, Hillsdale, Cool Valley, Pagedale, and Pine Lawn around 330 PM CDT. St. Louis, Bellefontaine Neighbors, Black Jack, Riverview, Spanish Lake, Moline Acres, Flordell Hills, and Castle Point around 335 PM CDT. Madison and Glasgow Village around 340 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Granite City, Pontoon Beach, Hartford, Edwardsville and South Roxana. This includes Interstate 70 in Missouri between exits 227 and 231. This also includes Scott Joplin Historic Site, Confluence State Park, First Missouri State Capitol Historic Site, and Horseshoe Lake State Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
